channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13277] add mob_threshold option to load test tool
item.description: This adds '-mob_threshold <value>' option to the load test tool to simplify mob load testing
item.summary: add mob_threshold option to load test tool

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: let's see if the bot picks this up.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12705444/HBASE-13277.hbase-11339.patch
against hbase-11339 branch at commit f9a17edc252a88c5a1a2c7764e3f9f65623e0ced.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 3 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.1 2.5.2 2.6.0)

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

Javadoc warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/13300//artifact/patchprocess/patchJavadocWarnings.txt
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/13300//console

This message is automatically generated.

+ protected static final String OPT_MOB_THRESHOLD_USAGE =
+ "Desired # of bytes for a cell to use the mob write path";

"When a cell exceeds this size, in bytes, it will use the MOB write path."

+ if (mobThreshold > 0) {

Can mobThreshold be 0 to indicate "all cells use mob write path" ?

Can mobThreshold be 0 to indicate "all cells use mob write path" ?

If the threshold is 0, it means all the cells whose value lengths are bigger than 0, they use the mob write path.
Right. The current tool only allows a minimum threshold of 1 byte.
Yes, it's better to use if(mobThreshold >= 0) here.

v2 rewords the message (still using "desired" since the other options do this as well), and change > to >= wrt to mobThreshold.

The javadoc errors will be addressed in another patch. (hooray for qabot)
